entries.meaning: One who is not married; a bachelor or a spinster.
examples: Perhaps the most awkward situation for the inexperienced young landlady was how to deal with “unweds.”

verbs.description: unwed (third-person singular simple present unweds, present participle unwedding, simple past and past participle unwed or unwedded)

examples: At last it was determined to unwed the unhappy pair, during the arrangements for which the husband was arrested and put into jail for six months for rioting.

A singer must be a fool indeed if you do not hear through Sullivan's notes the exact language of any song. Take, for example, the well-known Sentry song in Iolanthe and attempt to unwed the wit of the air from the wit of the thought and words;  […]
